content.processed:
Risky encounter

A risky encounter means that a healthy person met with someone who tested positive for COVID-19.

Signs of a risky encounter

Direct physical contact (e. g. a handshake, a kiss or a hug) or contact for 15 minutes or more with a distance of less than 2 meters.

Said contact took place. What's next?

If you've had a risky encounter with someone who is infected you should quarantine.

Do not wait for the regional hygiene station to call you. Please go into voluntary quarantine. If you were infected this will prevent further transmissions of the disease. Inform your GP about the risky encounter by phone. They will give you a request form for an RT-PCR test on COVID-19.

questions_answers.question: I had a risky encounter with person, who tested positiv for COVID-19, but its weekend and I can't contact my GP. What can I do?
questions_answers.value: After every risky encounter with an infected person, quarantine yourself voluntarily. There is a chance that you got infected. Please act responsibly and protect your friends and family. If there is anything unclear to you, call infoline 1221. Contact your GP as soon as possible.
